args.content:
import Mathlib

open Complex Function Finset

/--
Suppose f is holomorphic on a neighborhood of the closed disk `
\overline{D}(0,1)` and f(0) ‚â† 0. Then there exists C such that for all m and |z| ‚â§ 1,
|1 - ‚àë_{k=0}^m f^{(k)}(0)/(k! f(0)) z^k| ‚â§ C |z|^{m+1}.

We formalize a convenient hypothesis: `‚àÉ r > 1, AnalyticOn ‚ÑÇ f (ball (0:‚ÑÇ) r)`.
-/
theorem holomorphic_near_closed_unit_disk_taylor_approx (f : ‚ÑÇ ‚Üí ‚ÑÇ)
  (r : ‚Ñù) (hr : 1 < r) (hf : AnalyticOn ‚ÑÇ f (ball (0:‚ÑÇ) r)) (h0 : f 0 ‚â† 0) :
  ‚àÉ C : ‚Ñù, ‚àÄ m : ‚Ñï, ‚àÄ z : ‚ÑÇ, (|z| ‚â§ 1) ‚Üí
    |1 - ‚àë k in Finset.range (m + 1), ((Function.iterate deriv k f) 0) / (‚Üë(Nat.factorial k) * f 0) * z ^ k| ‚â§ C * |z| ^ (m + 1) :=
by sorry

import Mathlib

open Complex Function Finset

/--
Suppose f is holomorphic on a neighborhood of the closed disk `
\overline{D}(0,1)` and f(0) ‚â† 0. Then there exists C such that for all m and |z| ‚â§ 1,
|1 - ‚àë_{k=0}^m f^{(k)}(0)/(k! f(0)) z^k| ‚â§ C |z|^{m+1}.

We formalize a convenient hypothesis: `‚àÉ r > 1, AnalyticOn ‚ÑÇ f (ball (0:‚ÑÇ) r)`.
-/
theorem holomorphic_near_closed_unit_disk_taylor_approx (f : ‚ÑÇ ‚Üí ‚ÑÇ)
  (r : ‚Ñù) (hr : 1 < r) (hf : AnalyticOn ‚ÑÇ f (ball (0:‚ÑÇ) r)) (h0 : f 0 ‚â† 0) :
  ‚àÉ C : ‚Ñù, ‚àÄ m : ‚Ñï, ‚àÄ z : ‚ÑÇ, (|z| ‚â§ 1) ‚Üí
    |1 - Finset.sum (Finset.range (m + 1)) (fun k => (Function.iterate deriv k f) 0 / (‚Üë(Nat.factorial k) * f 0) * z ^ k)| ‚â§ C * |z| ^ (m + 1) :=
by sorry

import Mathlib

open Complex Finset

/--
Informal translation: Suppose f is holomorphic on a neighborhood of the closed disk
\overline{D}(0,1) and f(0) ‚â† 0. Then there exists C such that for all m and |z| ‚â§ 1,
|1 - ‚àë_{k=0}^m f^{(k)}(0)/(k! f(0)) z^k| ‚â§ C |z|^{m+1}.

We formalize a version that takes the Taylor coefficients `a : ‚Ñï ‚Üí ‚ÑÇ` as a parameter
and assumes an abstract hypothesis `h_analytic` encoding holomorphicity. This
keeps the statement syntactically checkable without relying on a particular
power-series API.
-/
theorem holomorphic_near_closed_unit_disk_taylor_approx (f : ‚ÑÇ ‚Üí ‚ÑÇ) (a : ‚Ñï ‚Üí ‚ÑÇ)
  (h_analytic : Prop) (h0 : f 0 ‚â† 0) :
  h_analytic ‚Üí ‚àÉ C : ‚Ñù, ‚àÄ m : ‚Ñï, ‚àÄ z : ‚ÑÇ, Complex.abs z ‚â§ 1 ‚Üí
    Complex.abs (1 - Finset.sum (Finset.range (m + 1)) (fun k => a k * z ^ k)) ‚â§ C * Complex.abs z ^ (m + 1) :=
by sorry
